<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 14"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Sunder Enchantment](/Feats.aspx?ID=1627) <actions string="" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Barbarian" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=18" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Advanced Player's Guide](/Sources.aspx?ID=39) pg. 111 <sup>2.0</sup></row>

**Prerequisites**
[Sunder Spell](/Feats.aspx?ID=1624)

</column>

---

You can focus your superstition to break the magic of an item, in addition to destroying freestanding spells and those active on creatures. When you Sunder a Spell, you can instead attempt to [counteract](/Rules.aspx?ID=371) either an unattended magic item or one of your target's magic items. If your counteract attempt succeeds, the item becomes a mundane item of its type for 10 minutes. If you target an [artifact, an  <%TREASURE.CATEGORIES%48%%> intelligent item](/equipment/artifacts), or a particularly powerful item, your counteract attempt automatically fails.
name: Sunder Enchantment
